```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
speed <- sample(10:100, 1) # m/s
wavelength <- sample(10:100, 1) # m
  
ans <- signif(speed / wavelength, 3) # freq (Hz)
dis <- c(speed * wavelength, wavelength / speed)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 6)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{Hz}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```
Question
========
A wave has a wavelength of $`r wavelength` \,\mathsf{m}$ and a speed of $`r speed` \,\mathsf{m/s}$.
What is its frequency?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Wave speed is wavelength times frequency ($v = \lambda f$). Therefore,

$$ f = \frac{v}{\lambda} = \frac{`r speed` \,\mathsf{m/s}}{`r wavelength` \,\mathsf{m}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{Hz}$$
